sentences.sContent: It is important that an adolescent boy should have an adult in whom he can confide.
sentences.sCn: 一个青春期男孩应该有一个他能倾吐心声的成年人，这是很重要的。

sentences.sContent: ...Pursuing a career is an essential part of adolescent development...
...teachers and clinicians would react to an adolescent using drugs or getting drunk...
...Another study of high school social networks found less bullying and aggression the higher the density of mixed-sex friendships within a given adolescent network...

remMethod.val: adol(看作adult， 成年人) ＋ esc(计算机上的退出键) ＋ ent(表人) → 好想从成年退回到青少年 → 青少年

words.tran: 进入青春期；如青春期少年般行事

trans.tranCn: 青春期的； 青少年的
trans.tranOther: Adolescent is used to describe young people who are no longer children but who have not yet become adults. It also refers to their behaviour.
a young person, usually between the ages of 12 and 18, who is developing into an adult
